greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle, T(n,k) = number of compositions a(1),...,a(j) of n with a(1) = k, such that a(i+1) <= a(i) + 1 for 1 <= i < j.
comment: The definition is a replica of the recursion formula in A005169: T(n,1) = A005169(n). Row sums, central terms and A003116 coincide: sum(T(n,k): k=1..n) = A003116(n); T(2*n-1,n) = A003116(n-1). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Sep 13 2013
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n=1..120 of triangle, flattened
maple: seq(seq(T(n, k), k=1..n), n=1..14); # _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 19 2013
mathematica: t[n_, k_] /; k > n = 0; t[n_, n_] = 1; t[n_, k_] := t[n, k] = Sum[ t[n-k, j], {j, 1, k+1}]; Flatten[ Table[ t[n, k], {n, 1, 13}, {k, 1, n}] ](* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 17 2012, after Pari *)
program: f xss = ys : f (ys : xss) where
ys = (map sum $ zipWith take [2..] xss) ++ [1] -- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Sep 13 2013
xref: Cf. A005169 (first column), A003116 (apparently row sums).
results.author: _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Nov 24 2009
